title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.11.27 | 17-07-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञान तिमिरान्धस्य ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षुरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्री गुरवे नमः
नमाओ मिष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रिष्ठाय भूतले श्री मते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्नितिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेशा शुन्यवादी पास्चात्यदेशतारिने जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभू नित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधरा श्रीवासादी गौरभक्त वृन्दा

Hare Krishna, Hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna, Hare Hare, Hare Rama, Hare Rama, Rama Rama, Hare Hare, Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya, Narayanam Namaskritya, Naram Jai Vanarottamam, Devim Sarasvatim Vyasam Tato Jaya Mudhirayet.

In this session we will be discussing from the 27th verse of the 11th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam. This 11th chapter is entitled Lord Krishna's Entrance into Dwaraka. So how the Dwaraka nivasis are receiving Krishna, that's the subject matter of this particular chapter.
Sitata Patra Vyajanair Upaskritaha Prasuna Varshair Abhivarshitah
Sitata Patra Vyajanair Upaskritaha Prasuna Vyajanair Upaskritaha Prasuna Vyajanair Upaskritaha
The meaning of this verse is, as the Lord passed along the public road of Dwaraka, his head was protected from the sunshine by a white umbrella.
White feathered fans moved in semi-circles and showers of flowers fell upon the holy land.
the road his yellow garments and garlands of flowers made it appear as if a

The white umbrella over his head is compared to the sun, the movement of the bunch hair fan of flukes is compared to the moon, the showers of flowers are compared to the stars, his yellow garments are compared to the rainbow.
So all these activities of the firmament, firmament means the sky, being impossible simultaneous factors, cannot be adjusted by comparison.
If you try to imagine that the scene was like all these appearing simultaneously, that is never possible as a natural phenomenon.
The advantage of the white umbrella over his head is that it can be adjusted by comparison.
The advantage of the white umbrella over his head is that it can be adjusted by comparison.
The adjustment is possible only when we think of the inconceivable potency of the Lord.

The adjustment is possible only when we think of the inconceivable potency of the Lord.
This is the important point to note here.
Why? Because the Lord is all-powerful.
And in His presence, anything impossible can be made possible by His inconceivable energy.
So the Lord, by His inconceivable energy, makes the impossible also possible.
Supremely powerful. Unlimitedly powerful. Infinitely powerful.

So, we cannot imagine all this.

Then, what to speak of the spiritual world?
We cannot calculate even something of the material world perfectly.
So, the best thing is to follow the process, the Vedic process,
to receive knowledge by the descending process.
Descending process means the perfect knowledge is available
from the Supreme Lord, coming down in the parampara system.
We simply have to receive it.
And for receiving such knowledge, we have to prepare ourselves.
And that preparation is nothing but the practice of spiritual life.
And it is perfect knowledge handed down.
we can't even conceive what is the nature of things in this one universe.
There are millions of such universes.
Each universe has millions of planets.
Each planet has millions of living entities.
Each living entity has millions of complicated structures within their form.
There are 3 trillion cells within our body.
And there are 200 varieties of cells.
All this is inconceivable for our tiny brain to accommodate.
Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
